title.narrative: Small Business, Agriculture, and Livelihood Assistance (SALA) Yemen

description.narrative: Livestock restocking as complementary source of food; Beekeeping through the introduction of the langstroth beehives and links to national honey incubators; Irrigation activities will provide support for repairs and replacement of irrigation systems, parts or equipment; Livehoods restoration through vouchers to assist beneficiaries in restoring productive assets; WASH component will prioratize repairs to safe drinking water infrastructures, the installation and rehabilitation of water pumps, and water trucking. A voucher system will also be used to provide WASH NFIs for households (i.e. cholera kits as required, and hand washing systems).

The overall strategic approach of the SALA program aligns with these broad programmatic priorities of humanitarian actors in Yemen by building resilience among conflict-affected populations through restored livelihoods that can increase food availability and mitigate economic access constraints. In response to the ongoing cholera outbreak, the Cost Modification for the SALA project has further been expanded to include WASH and Nutrition components. The project will be implemented in close coordination with ADRA’s ongoing FFP-funded FAADL program, through which ADRA is providing food voucher assistance to the most vulnerable households in the same geographic areas of Southern Yemen. The combined programming addresses all three areas identified by the HNO by delivering emergency food assistance needed to maintain food security and prevent malnutrition through food vouchers, while more durable solutions are supported as livelihoods are restored. These activities support OFDA’s mandate “to save lives, alleviate human suffering, and reduce the social and economic impact of disasters”.
